      • createCache

        public java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<?,?> createCache(java.lang.String cacheName,
                                                  java.util.Set<IClusterServices.cacheMode> cMode)
                                                    throws CacheExistException,
                                                           CacheConfigException
        Description copied from interface: IClusterServicesCommon
        Method that will create a new named cache. The data structure if already present will cause an exception to be thrown to the caller.
        Specified by:
        createCache in interface IClusterServicesCommon
        Parameters:
        cacheName - Name of the ConcurrentHashMap to create
        cMode - Mode of the cache that need to be retrieved. This is a set such that more than one property can be provided, of course contrasting requirements will not be accepted and in that case an exception is thrown
        Returns:
        ConcurrentHashMap to be used to modify the data structure
        Throws:
        CacheExistException
        CacheConfigException

      • destroyCache

        public void destroyCache(java.lang.String cacheName)
        Description copied from interface: IClusterServicesCommon
        Destroy a cachename given cachename, if doesn't exist the function does nothing. If the datastructure exists, the whole cluster will destroy the instance
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        cacheName - Name of the ConcurrentHashMap to destroy

        public void tbegin()
            throws javax.transaction.NotSupportedException,
                   javax.transaction.SystemException
        Description copied from interface: IClusterServicesCommon
        Begin a transaction covering with all the data structures/HW updates. One transaction per-thread can be opened at the most, that means if multiple thread are available, multiple transactions can be outstanding.

      • amICoordinator

        public boolean amICoordinator()
        Description copied from interface: IClusterServicesCommon
        Function that is used to know if the node on which is called is the cluster coordinator. The API is useful in scenario where the same logic is not worthed to be replicated on multiple nodes in the cluster and one can cook it up for all the others. In this scenario running the logic on the coordinator make sense, this of course implies logics that are not heavy and don't need to be scaled out linearly with the size of the cluster.
        Specified by:
        amICoordinator in interface IClusterServicesCommon
        Returns:
        true if the node on which the API is called is the coordinator for the cluster
